section.title: Location-Speakers
section.para: Varieties and subdialects of Agaw (or Central) Cushitic language: Awngi is spoken mainly in the Amhara region, southwest of Lake Tana, and in scattered nearby localities. The variety represented here is that of the village of Bert'a Abbo in the province of Agawmeder, as described by Robert Hetzron in his 1969 monograph.

biblioset.title: The Verbal System of Southern Agaw

inflectionClass: as in all languages, phonological and grammaticization processes conspire to create more or less marked morphophonemic differences in the verbal inflections of different sets of verbs. [see below]

section.title: Attested Archive Paradigms
section.para:
The following tabel lists the shared property=value pairs for each paradigm, and then the variable property=value-list (comma separated). The abbreviation "PNG" in the paradigm variable-value lists stnads for:
gender:f,m,⊤ number:pl,sg person:p1,p2,p3
I.e., the PNG combinations normal with finite tam-forms.Clicking on the paradigmLabel will yield a display of the paradigm in question [either by link to hard-coded term cluster, or canned SPARQL query].

table.caption: Table: Prop:Val List of Default Paradigms

td.literallayout: clauseType:exobligative defClass:U gender:x22a4 number:sg person:p1 polarity:negative pos:verb tnsAspMod:converb
clauseType:exobligative defClass:definite gender:x22a4 number:sg person:p1 polarity:negative pos:verb tnsAspMod:imperfect
clauseType:main gender:x22a4 person:x22a4 polarity:affirmative pos:verb tnsAspMod:order
clauseType:main gender:x22a4 person:x22a4 polarity:negative pos:verb tnsAspMod:order
